name: NANA-REMIX
description: This is a telegram bot writen in python

INI.description: Setting this to ANYTHING will enable webhooks when in env mode

api_id.description: get your api id from https://my.telegram.org

api_hash.description: get your api hash from https://my.telegram.org

LOGGER.description: True if you want to log everything that happens in the userbot

DB_URI.description: the postgresql server url that contains username, host, port, password and database

NANA_IMG.description: an image url or file id supported by pyrogram bot

AdminSettings.description: Add Sudo user ids here, you can separate each user id with a space

Command.description: a command prefix(s), you can separate each prefix with a space

REPOSITORY.description: url of the repository of your fork, leave it on Original Repository if you clone it without forking

REMINDER_UPDATE.description: Leave it on True if you want to receive updates from github

screenshotlayer_API.description: get an api key from ScreenshotLayer

gdrive_credentials.description: paste in the content inside credentials json you get from google drive api, this is not required as if the bot will guide you how to setup after you host it

sw_api.description: spamwatch api key, carefully read SpamWatchAPI

lydia_api.description: coffeehouse api key for chatbot, get it now from Intellivoid

remove_bg_api.description: Remove Background API key, get it from Remove.bg

time_country.description: input your timezone from this List

USERBOT_LOAD.description: Fill if you want to load up some modules for your userbot (separate with space)

USERBOT_NOLOAD.description: Fill if you want to ignore some modules for your userbot (separate with space)

ASSISTANT_LOAD.description: Fill if you want to load up some modules for your ASSISTANT (separate with space)

ASSISTANT_NOLOAD.description: Fill if you want to ignore some modules for your ASSISTANT (separate with space)

USERBOT_SESSION.description: Generate your session using strNana.py in the repository by running python3 strNana.py

PM_PERMIT.description: True or Leave the Field if you dont want the PM Gaurd on
